intro: Cinchona glabra, commonly known as the bark tree or quinine tree, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant is most notable for its bark, which contains the alkaloid quinine, historically used to treat malaria. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes, typically between 1,000 and 2,000 meters. Due to its medicinal significance, it has been cultivated in various parts of the world for centuries.
